name: Model United Nations
description: Debate global issues, practice diplomacy, and develop leadership skills in our award-winning MUN club.
whatYouDo: Weekly debates on current global issues and position papers
Conference preparation workshops and public speaking training
Participate in national and international MUN conferences
Research and represent different countries' perspectives

faq.q: Do I need previous MUN experience?
faq.a: No! We welcome beginners and provide comprehensive training for new delegates.
Weekly meetings plus occasional weekend conferences (2-3 per semester).
Conference fees are partially subsidized by the school. Delegates contribute approximately 2,000 THB per conference.

name: Eco Committee
description: Lead environmental initiatives and make our school more sustainable through hands-on projects and campaigns.
whatYouDo: Organize campus-wide recycling and waste reduction programs
Maintain the school garden and composting system
Plan Earth Day celebrations and environmental awareness campaigns
Collaborate with local environmental organizations

faq.q: Can I join if I'm new to environmental issues?
faq.a: Absolutely! We provide education and training for all members regardless of experience.

faq.q: Do we work outside of school hours?
faq.a: Most activities are during club time, but we have optional weekend community projects.

name: SPARK Community Service
description: Ignite positive change in our community through meaningful service projects and volunteer opportunities.
whatYouDo: Visit local orphanages and elderly care centers monthly
Organize donation drives for underprivileged communities
Tutor primary school students in nearby schools
Plan and execute community development projects

faq.q: How often do we do community visits?
faq.a: We organize field visits twice a month, usually on Saturdays.

faq.q: Can I get CAS hours from this club?
faq.a: Yes! All our activities count towards your CAS requirements.

name: Duke of Edinburgh International Award
description: Challenge yourself through adventurous expeditions, skill development, and community service to earn an internationally recognized award.
whatYouDo: Train for and complete adventurous journeys and expeditions
Develop new skills in areas of personal interest
Engage in regular physical recreation activities
Contribute to community service projects

faq.a: Bronze Award: 14+, Silver Award: 15+, Gold Award: 16+

faq.q: How long does it take to complete?
faq.a: Bronze: 6 months minimum, Silver: 12 months, Gold: 18 months
Yes, expedition costs and registration fees apply (approximately 5,000-8,000 THB per level).

name: Moot Court
description: Experience the legal world through mock trials, legal debates, and courtroom simulations.
whatYouDo: Prepare and argue legal cases in mock trial settings
Learn about Thai and international legal systems
Develop critical thinking and public speaking skills
Compete in inter-school moot court competitions

faq.q: Do I need to want to be a lawyer to join?
faq.a: Not at all! The skills you learn here apply to many careers.

faq.q: How competitive is it to get in?
faq.a: We accept students who show genuine interest and commitment, regardless of experience.

name: Interact Club
description: Join Rotary International's youth network to develop leadership skills while serving your community.
whatYouDo: Plan and execute community service projects
Collaborate with local Rotary clubs on initiatives
Participate in international Interact conferences
Develop leadership through hands-on project management

faq.q: What's the difference between Interact and other service clubs?
faq.a: Interact is part of Rotary International, giving us access to a global network and resources.
Yes, there's a small annual fee of 500 THB to cover materials and activities.

name: Operation Smile
description: Support the global mission to provide free surgeries for children with cleft conditions through fundraising and awareness.
whatYouDo: Organize fundraising events for surgical missions
Create awareness campaigns about cleft conditions
Volunteer at Operation Smile Thailand events
Coordinate with hospitals and medical professionals

faq.q: Do we get to meet the children we help?
faq.a: Yes! We visit partner hospitals and participate in mission events when possible.

faq.q: What kind of fundraising do we do?
faq.a: Bake sales, charity concerts, sponsored walks, and our annual gala dinner.

name: UNICEF Ambassadors
description: Advocate for children's rights and support UNICEF's mission through awareness campaigns and fundraising initiatives.
whatYouDo: Organize campaigns for children's rights awareness
Fundraise for UNICEF programs in Thailand and globally
Participate in UNICEF youth forums and conferences
Create educational content about global children's issues

faq.q: How do we work with UNICEF Thailand?
faq.a: We're officially registered as a UNICEF youth group and receive support from their Bangkok office.

faq.q: Can I join if I'm not fluent in English?
faq.a: Yes! We work in both Thai and English depending on the project.
